programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented for the picking. From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: WESH 2: Saving Our Streets
programme.desc: As Central Florida deals with an increase in violence, WESH 2 launches Saving Our Streets, an effort to understand the root of this issue, and showcase the people, grassroots organizations, and programs working to turn things around. Learn how Saving Our Streets is a call to action for our larger community to be part of the solution.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminals and a casino magnates family forever.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A serial killer preys on women from a hardscrabble section of Daytona Beach, Florida. Detectives have boxes of DNA and ballistic evidence. They just don't have a suspect.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nations largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, Americas native spirit.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: DJ Jenelle J.Belle Vannoy is living her dream of working in radio. She worked all over the country before landing in Albuquerque. As the voice of the city but new to the area, her desire to learn more about Duke City has Jenelle ready for adventure.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Ted wants to live to 100 with his beloved wife beside him. But his oral health threatens his future. Kristys a FIXT staffer desperate to smile big on her wedding day. Will love help them face their fears?

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented for the picking. From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Sunset sweets, arts and crafts and deep thoughts on two cheap dates in New Orleans.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Relive the '50s, sip smokin cocktails, and discover salty licorice fish in Amish country's hidden gem.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: More than money makes the crime world go round. You wont believe the odd array of goods that have been stolen over the years -- and the motivations behind the thefts.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Whether you play an instrument, or just love to listen, music provides a source of joy. From kids chasing their dreams to grandparents passing on what they know to the next generation, music is more than just a melody.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: A car or the T might be the typical way to travel, but Robs on a mission to explore some of the more unique modes of transport the Boston areas got to offer.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From Naval helicopter pilot to fantasy costume designer, Zan Campbells life has been an adventure. Learn about his journey to find purpose and inspire joy in others.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: In what has to be the stinkiest episode we've ever had, Frank Nicotero asks Cincinnati locals wild and wacky news trivia. You'll be glad you can't smell some of these stories.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes the bad guys are busted by regular people! These stories showcase good Samaritans stopping suspects in their tracks.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Manny Hernandez of Barrels and Boards in Raynham pushes the pace against Chef Ryan Dziki of Wild Fox Pierogi. Will the chefs be able to identify the right ingredients and replicate each others sauces before the clock runs out?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: In honor of Pittsburgh's love of handhelds, Chef Claudy Pierre and Chef Alex Brown get creative crafting their best sandwich-inspired dishes.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Ryan, Justin, and Jimmy enjoy a Cincinnati summer playing pickleball for charity. Ryan and Jimmy compete in an ice cream taste test. Later, Justin takes a young lady on a shopping spree to celebrate her resilience in addressing her mental health.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Step into the heartwarming charm of Dayton, Ohio! Cheer on the Dragons, step back in time to savor artisan ales and unwind at an exotic glamping retreat. The Gem City offers plenty of reasons to smile.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The disappearance of 16-year-old JaRay Wilson spawns rumors of human trafficking in her small town in 2012. Investigators find her body and the truth, after an unlikely informant provides new details.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into the Midwest's sweets. From the messy madness of puppy chow to kolaches to the infamous buckeye, enjoy the delicious confections that make the region a haven for dessert lovers.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Dedicated mom and nurse, Cleo, spends a day filled with surprises. This incredible mother has overcome obstacles no parent should have to face. Cleo and her sons cook up some quality time.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Single father Kendal Fenwick is the 295th homicide in Baltimore in 2015. Family and investigators wonder whether his efforts to curb drugs and violence in his neighborhood made him a target. Or is it something else entirely?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cias seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented for the picking. From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact learns how conservatives are balancing their political values and their concerns about climate change. Plus, an organization focuses on the financial struggles of working families. And, a former NFL cheerleader turned chef receives a James Beard award.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nations largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, Americas native spirit.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented for the picking. From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminals and a casino magnates family forever.
